title: What is the Prince song '7' about? - Quora

response.answer_text: THE REAL MEANING OF PRINCE’S LOVE SYMBOL – “7” SONG INTERPRETATION Some look at the Bible in a strictly numerological way..in the old testament the Hebrew letters were looked upon as a type of Codex to know the mind of God…the Kabbalah looks at the Tree of Life which the seeker can use to rise Spiritually from malkuth the kingdom of earth to Kether the crown of heaven…Seven is the Number of God……the Seven Deadly sins stand in way of love…greed, lust, pride, envy, gluttony. wrath, sloth - an excess of the worst of human traits keep us from love, which is God………..Prince refers to god as love/sexy….the eternal struggle between the physical love -eros-and metaphysical love - the transcendence of the body to reunite as one with the creator…Prince uses this song to show the love that can bring peace and eternal life and also he shows us the power of Soulmates, which Prince believed he and Mayte were…the Gnostic Spirituality tells of a monad descending to the physical plain and splitting into Male and Female aspects…….i.e. Valentin and Sophia……Sophia the female is the container of wisdom…Val...the male -is blind and INSANE…….. SO listen to the “origin of love” from Hedwig…read the Book of Revelations……..give the Kabballah a shot….all while dancing to prince music……Music is the gift of uplift…. imo gf please do not take my word for Anything……….like Socrates -and Jon Snow … i know NOTHING.

It seems to me to be the Book of Revelation filtered through Prince, re-imaged by Prince. Basically, it seems to be the Book of Revelation as it would have been written had Prince been the recipient of the vision and not John The Apostle. There is an element of love being the force that will ultimately be triumphant at the end of time. Seven is a holy number in the Bible, but in this song, 7 seems to be an evil (or at least malevolent) force. They stand in the way of love, after all! At this point, we’ll never know for sure what Prince was thinking when he wrote this. In fact, at the time he wrote this song, Prince may not have even been fully aware of the meaning of this creation. That happens with great art. The meaning of “Raspberry Beret” or “Sister” or “Let’s Pretend We’re Married” was a little more clear, to say the least.
